meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -!

I'm excited to dive into Diablo 3: Ultimate Evil Edition on PS4, and I'm not just saying that because I'm a grog with a sweet tooth for lootin' and shootin' (okay, maybe a little). This review's gonna be so lit, you'll need shades.

Let's get the obvious out of the way: this game is an absolute blast. Like, who doesn't love hacking demons to bits with your trusty sword or casting fireballs at hordes of baddies? The combat feels snappy and satisfying, even on my not-so-grog-like reflexes (don't tell anyone, but I'm still getting used to these "controllers").

But what really sets Diablo 3 apart is its addictive nature. You'll find yourself saying things like, "Just one more level," or, "Oh, just one more hour." Before you know it, the sun's gone down, and your cat's been playing with your hair for hours (no judgment). This game knows how to keep you hooked.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about the critics?" Ah, yes! Those fancy-pants reviewers who get to play games before anyone else (spoiled). Well, let me tell you, they're not wrong. Most of them agree that Diablo 3 is an absolute gem, with Eurogamer Portugal giving it a perfect score and Vandal saying it's a must-play (no pressure). PSX Extreme even praises the game's "excellent presentation" and "hours upon hours of blissful looting." Hardcore Gamer calls it a "flying success," while Gamestyle says it's "a wonderful experience you cannot help but want to share."

But, hey, no one's perfect. Even Giant Bomb, with their 80/100 score, can't help but admit that the game's great... when you're playing with friends or by yourself. Yeah, I guess even they need some company (awkward).

In conclusion, Diablo 3: Ultimate Evil Edition on PS4 is a fantastic addition to any gamer's library. It's an action-packed, loot-filled good time with friends or solo. And hey, if you're feeling extra generous, share it with your cat â€“ they'll love the hair play.

Time for me to go catch some Zs; I've got a demon-infested night ahead of me...
